answerText: Philip Larkin[10] This Larkin poem speculates on the lives of an earl and countess, who lay "side by side, their faces blurred." This poem concludes "what will survive of us is love."
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 8 | 4 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: He stated that he would "construct a religion" that would "make use of water" in his poem "Water." [10] Name this English poet who wrote "They fuck you up your mum and dad" in his poem "This Be the Verse."
